titles.title: To clarify State authority to tax compensation paid to certain employees.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 105-203.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 124.

action.text: Mr. Gekas moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Referred jointly to the Committees on Governmental Affairs; Finance by unanimous consent.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Hearings held.

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

bill.summary: 6/18/1997--Introduced. Amends Federal law to subject pay and compensation paid to an individual for personal services at Fort Campbell, Kentucky, to taxation by the State or any political subdivision thereof of which the employee is a resident. Subjects pay or compensation paid by the United States for personal services as a U.S. employee at a U.S.-owned hydroelectric facility to taxation by the State or any political subdivision of which the employee is a resident if the facility is on: (1) the Columbia River, portions of which are in Washington and Oregon; or (2) the Missouri River, portions of which are in South Dakota and Nebraska.
